fine_dining.name: Eckstein by Albert
fine_dining.atmosphere: Upscale, cozy wine cellar feel with intimate dining rooms
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance, especially weekends. Popular with locals and food enthusiasts.
fine_dining.local_tips: Excellent wine list featuring Styrian wines, knowledgeable staff. Ask for wine pairings with regional specialties. The tasting menu is the best way to experience the full range of Styrian cuisine.

fine_dining.name: Aiola Upstairs
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, panoramic city views with elegant contemporary design
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request outdoor seating in summer for the best views of Graz. Book at least a week in advance for weekend dining.
fine_dining.local_tips: Accessible via Schlossberg lift or funicular. Perfect for romantic dinners with stunning city views. Try their seasonal menu featuring local Styrian ingredients.

fine_dining.name: Aiola im Schloss
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, historic mansion with beautiful gardens and refined dining rooms
fine_dining.booking_tips: Ideal for special occasions, requires car/taxi. Book well in advance for events and weekend dining.
fine_dining.local_tips: Beautiful setting, especially the gardens. Perfect for wedding receptions and corporate events. The wine cellar offers excellent regional wine selections.

fine_dining.name: Landhauskeller
fine_dining.atmosphere: Historic cellar restaurant with traditional Austrian charm and warm ambiance
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve ahead, especially for weekend dining. Popular with both locals and tourists.
fine_dining.local_tips: Historic setting in the heart of Graz. Excellent for experiencing traditional Austrian cuisine in an authentic atmosphere. Try their house-made schnapps.

casual_dining.name: Der Steirer
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, noisy, popular with a warm and welcoming vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve ahead, can be very busy especially during lunch and dinner hours.
casual_dining.local_tips: Extensive local wine list featuring Styrian wines. Also has a shop selling regional products. Try their Brettljause for a traditional Styrian experience.

casual_dining.name: Gasthaus Glöcklbräu
casual_dining.atmosphere: Authentic, traditional gasthaus with cozy interior and beer garden
casual_dining.booking_tips: Good spot for lunch in the Old Town. No reservations needed but can get busy during peak hours.
casual_dining.local_tips: Try the local Glöckl Bräu beer or Schilcher wine. The beer garden is perfect for summer dining. Traditional Austrian hospitality at its best.

casual_dining.name: Gösser Bräu
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional brewery, beer garden with lively atmosphere
casual_dining.booking_tips: Large beer garden is great in summer. No reservations needed but can get crowded during peak hours.
casual_dining.local_tips: Try different types of Gösser beer. The beer garden offers a perfect setting for enjoying traditional Austrian cuisine with friends.

casual_dining.name: Gasthaus zur Steirischen Weinstube
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy wine tavern with traditional Styrian charm
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve ahead for dinner, especially on weekends. Popular with wine enthusiasts.
casual_dining.local_tips: Excellent wine list focusing on Styrian wines. Perfect for experiencing the region's wine culture. Ask for wine recommendations with your meal.

casual_dining.name: Gasthaus Lendplatzl
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional Austrian gasthaus with warm, family-friendly atmosphere
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations needed but can get busy during peak hours. Good for families.
casual_dining.local_tips: Family-run establishment with authentic Austrian hospitality. Perfect for experiencing traditional Austrian cuisine in a relaxed setting.

street_food.name: Delikatessen Frankowitsch
street_food.local_tips: Historic institution, part deli/cafe. Can be busy, grab a pfiff (small beer). Perfect for a quick lunch or coffee break. Try their traditional Austrian sandwiches.

street_food.name: Standl 5 – Wurscht is my business
street_food.local_tips: A popular sausage stand often found at markets. Perfect for experiencing authentic Austrian street food. Try their traditional Austrian sausages with mustard.

street_food.name: Bäckerei Sorger
street_food.local_tips: Traditional Austrian bakery with excellent pastries and bread. Perfect for breakfast or coffee break. Try their traditional Austrian pastries.

street_food.name: Eis Greissler
street_food.local_tips: High-quality artisanal ice cream made with local ingredients. Perfect for a sweet treat while exploring the city. Try their seasonal flavors.

coffee_shops.name: Hofbäckerei Edegger-Tax
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Charming, historic with beautiful traditional Austrian décor
coffee_shops.food_options: Traditional Austrian pastries, cakes, and light meals
coffee_shops.local_tips: Oldest bakery in Graz (since 1569), beautiful facade. Perfect for experiencing traditional Austrian café culture. Try their famous Sissi-Busserl.

coffee_shops.name: Delikatessen Frankowitsch
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bustling, traditional with authentic Austrian charm
coffee_shops.food_options: Traditional Austrian sandwiches, pastries, and coffee
coffee_shops.local_tips: Good for a quick coffee and snack, Austrian aperitivo feel. Historic institution perfect for experiencing local café culture.

coffee_shops.name: Café Central
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Elegant, historic with classic Austrian café charm
coffee_shops.food_options: Traditional Austrian pastries, cakes, and light meals
coffee_shops.local_tips: Classic Austrian café experience in the heart of Graz. Perfect for people-watching and enjoying traditional Austrian coffee culture.

coffee_shops.name: Café Promenade
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, cozy with contemporary Austrian style
coffee_shops.food_options: Modern Austrian cuisine, pastries, and coffee
coffee_shops.local_tips: Contemporary take on Austrian café culture. Perfect for working or meeting friends. Try their seasonal coffee specialties.

bars.name: Gösser Bräu
bars.atmosphere: Traditional, lively with authentic Austrian beer garden atmosphere
bars.food_options: Traditional Austrian pub food, pretzels, and hearty dishes
bars.local_tips: Classic Austrian beer experience. Perfect for experiencing traditional Austrian beer culture. The beer garden is especially popular in summer.

bars.name: Aiola Upstairs Bar
bars.atmosphere: Stylish, panoramic views with modern cocktail bar ambiance
bars.food_options: Light bar snacks and small plates
bars.local_tips: Great spot for drinks with a view, especially at sunset. Perfect for romantic evenings or special occasions. Book ahead for the best seats.

bars.name: Brot & Spiele
bars.atmosphere: Casual, modern with craft beer focus
bars.local_tips: Excellent selection of craft beers from Austria and beyond. Perfect for beer enthusiasts. Knowledgeable staff can recommend beers based on your preferences.

bars.name: Kulturhauskeller
bars.local_tips: Located in a cultural center, often hosts events and live music. Perfect for experiencing Graz's cultural scene while enjoying drinks.

food_tours.name: Graz Food Tour with Testesser
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance. Perfect for food enthusiasts wanting to explore Styrian cuisine.

food_tours.name: Graz Food Festival Tours
food_tours.booking_tips: Check Graz Food Festival schedule (typically August). Book early as festival events are popular.

food_tours.name: Styrian Wine Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Perfect for wine enthusiasts. Tours include transportation to nearby vineyards.

cooking_classes.name: Styrian Cooking Workshop
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve your spot at least two weeks in advance. Perfect for learning authentic Styrian cooking techniques.

cooking_classes.name: Austrian Pastry Workshop
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Check for seasonal classes and holiday specials. Popular during Christmas season.

markets.name: Farmers Market at Kaiser Josef Platz
markets.local_tips: Largest farmers market in Graz, great atmosphere. Perfect for experiencing local food culture and buying regional specialties.

markets.name: Farmers Market at Lendplatz
highlights: More relaxed atmosphere than Kaiser Josef Platz
markets.local_tips: Located in the Lend district, good to combine with exploring the area. Less crowded than the main market.

markets.name: Christmas Market
markets.local_tips: Magical Christmas atmosphere with traditional Austrian treats. Perfect for experiencing Austrian Christmas culture.
